intro: Chaerophyllum pauciradiatum, commonly known as the lesser umbrella fern, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shady environments, often found in woodland areas. The plant produces small, white flowers in umbrella-shaped clusters, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are aromatic and can be used in herbal remedies, though it is not widely cultivated for commercial purposes. The species is native to Europe and parts of Asia, where it thrives in temperate climates.
